intro: Kayea laevis, commonly known as the smooth kayea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Kayea laevis typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
